You are given an array of $n$ integers, where each integer from 1 to $n$ appears exactly twice. You can rearrange the elements of the array in any order. 

For each integer $i$, let $x_i$ and $y_i$ be the positions of the two occurrences of integer $i$ in the rearranged array (where $x_i < y_i$).  The distance between the positions of integer $i$ is defined as $y_i - x_i$.

Find a rearrangement of the array that minimizes the sum of the distances between the positions of all the integers.

Output the rearranged array.

You are given a list of numbers from 1 to n repeated twice. Rearrange the numbers in the list to minimize the sum of the differences between where each number appears in the rearranged list. Output the rearranged list.
